titleInfo.title: USA v. Voss
titleInfo.subTitle: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The United States' Motion for Issuance of Preliminary Order of Forfeiture 21 is hereby sustained. The United States Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms for the District of Nebraska ("ATF") is hereby authorized to seize the Hi-Point.45 caliber semi-automatic pistol, serial number X454091. The aforementioned forfeited property is to be held by ATF in its secure custody and control. Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture as to defendant Matthew M. Voss. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. - (2 certified copies to the USM) (KBJ)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The United States' Motion for Issuance of Preliminary Order of Forfeiture 21 is hereby sustained. The United States Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms for the District of Nebraska ("ATF") is hereby authorized to seize the Hi-Point.45 caliber semi-automatic pistol, serial number X454091. The aforementioned forfeited property is to be held by ATF in its secure custody and control. Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture as to defendant Matthew M. Voss. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. - (2 certified copies to the USM) (KBJ)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Voss
titleInfo.subTitle: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE - IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED, ADJUDGED AND DECREED as follows: The Plaintiff's Motion for Final Order of Forfeiture 26 is hereby sustained. All right, title and interest in and to the Hi-Point.45 caliber semi-automatic pistol, serial number X454091, held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed. The United States Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms for the District of Nebraska is directed to dispose of said property in accordance with law as to defendant Matthew M. Voss. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. - (2 certified copies to the USM)(KBJ)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE - IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED, ADJUDGED AND DECREED as follows: The Plaintiff's Motion for Final Order of Forfeiture 26 is hereby sustained. All right, title and interest in and to the Hi-Point.45 caliber semi-automatic pistol, serial number X454091, held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed. The United States Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms for the District of Nebraska is directed to dispose of said property in accordance with law as to defendant Matthew M. Voss. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. - (2 certified copies to the USM)(KBJ)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Voss
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Matthew M. Voss (1), Counts 1 and 2 - DEFENDANT pleaded guilty to counts I and II of the Indictment and is committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of fifty-one (51) months; 3 years supervised release with special conditions; $100.00 special assessment as to defendant Matthew M. Voss. The defendant shall forfeit the defendant's interest in the following property to the United States: Hi-Point.45 caliber semiautomatic pistol bearing the serial number X454091, and ammunition. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (4 certified copies to US Marshal)(ADB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to Matthew M. Voss (1), Counts 1 and 2 - DEFENDANT pleaded guilty to counts I and II of the Indictment and is committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of fifty-one (51) months; 3 years supervised release with special conditions; $100.00 special assessment as to defendant Matthew M. Voss. The defendant shall forfeit the defendant's interest in the following property to the United States: Hi-Point.45 caliber semiautomatic pistol bearing the serial number X454091, and ammunition. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (4 certified copies to US Marshal)(ADB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Voss
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - Pursuant to NECivR 79.1(f) or NECrimR 55.1(g), counsel for the government shall either 1) withdraw the following exhibits previously submitted in this matter within 15 calendar days of the date of this order, or 2) show cause why the exhibits should not be destroyed. If counsel fails to withdraw these exhibits as directed or to show cause why the exhibits should not be destroyed, the clerk's office is directed to destroy the listed exhibits without further notice to the parties or order from the court as to defendant Matthew M. Voss. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (TJS)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
